result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody Kort Stuhr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jody Kort Stuhr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jody Kort Stuhr was found guilty of Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Jody Kort Stuhr was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Defendant to report to Probation by November 20, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes: $185.44 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF145.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF145.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF145.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Youth Action at 901 4th Street Hudson WI.
-Letter of apology to Youth Action.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski  DF:  Jody Kort Stuhr appeared. Case called at 2:41. Includes 15CF145, 15CF318. ADA Hartung updates the court.  Atty. Kucinski agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to amended count Ct 1 to misdemeanor theft and Ct 3 in 15CF145. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 misdemeanor theft and Ct 3 in 15CF145. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF145 and 15CF318. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 
2 years probation on both counts.  Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- 90 days condition time STAYED
- 20 hours community service
- Costs on both counts
- Restitution of $185.44
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Youth Action 901 4th St.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Letter of apology to youth action. 

DE to report to probation by tomorrow 4:00pm
Plea hearing at 11-18-2015 02:30 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Jody Kort Stuhr appeared. Case called at 10:23 am. Includes: 15CF145 and 15CF318, set for Plea Hearing. Atty. Kucinski requests plea hearing be reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Deiss, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF:  Jody Kort Stuhr appeared. Case called at 4:03. Includes 15CF318, 15CF145. Atty. Kucinski updates the court and requests a plea hearing. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference at 09-28-2015 04:00 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. DF ATTY: Alex Andrea for today only. DF:  Jody Kort Stuhr appeared. Case called at 10:46. Includes 15CF318 (INIT) 15CF145(PTC) Court reviews files. On 15CF318 Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Atty. Andrea updates the court and requests to set both files for a PTC. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

**AMENDED**
Includes 15CF145, 15CF318

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  901 2nd Street, Ste #207 Hudson, WI or any occupants.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Defendant to call the jail every Saturday to give address by 5:00pm.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
filed by ADA Jennifer Bork. eif
Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  901 2nd Street, Ste #207 Hudson, WI or any occupants.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Defendant to call the jail every Saturday to give address.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
